result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan J Prag was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:

Case called at 2:07pm [ma]
Defendant Jonathan J Prag in court with attorney Walter Arthur Piel.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered; factual basis stipulated;the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 

the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--to submit DNA sample
--to pay statutory costs

Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 2:19pm

[MK] case called at 3:12pm. 
Defendant Jonathan J Prag in court with Attorney Walter A Piel.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Piel requests that the case be set for plea and sentencing in a few weeks.  Attorney Piel just received discovery today, and he would like time to go over that with Mr. Prag before proceeding to a change in plea.
The Court continues Bail as fixed.

Defendant's
Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek
Scheduling notice

case called at 1:32pm. [mo]
Defendant Jonathan J Prag appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Atty. Svehlek indicates that Mr. Prag is eligible for PD representation 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Atty. Svehlek requests an adjourned intital app. and bond set 

The Court requires a $1,500  signature bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Jacob Mertz
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns or package houses
--Mr. Prag will have a curfew from the hours of 11:00pm to 6:00am unless as necessary for work
recess 1:35 pm. 


NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance: July 21, 2015 at 2:00pm
